resources.string: "Mode" for generating text: \'completion\' for completing a prompt or sentence, and \'chat\' for generating text in a conversational context.
"GPT model" to use for text generation: Each model has different capabilities and performance on different tasks.
"Temperature" controls text creativity: lower values produce conservative, predictable text, while higher values result in more creative and unexpected text.
"The "maximum number of tokens (words or symbols) to generate in the output.
"TopP" controls text diversity: higher values, more diverse output; lower values, more repetition.
"Frequency penalty": controls how much the model avoids repeating words or phrases in output.
"Presence penalty": controls how much the model avoids including prompt words or phrases in output.
"Stop": Up to 4 sequences; API stops generating tokens beyond them. Omitted in response. (press comma to enter, "\\n" converts)
"Logit Bias": Adjust the likelihood of specific tokens appearing in the text by applying a bias value. ("token_id=weight", weight -100 : 100)
"n" parameter: controls the number of output sequences the model returns.
"Best of": controls the number of output sequences the model generates, returning the highest-scoring one.
"Inject start text": text to add before the generated output.
"Inject restart text": text to add between multiple output sequences.
"System message": message used to instruct ChatGPT on how to behave and the context to reference.
